newsitem.title: USA: American Gas Association names new president.
newsitem.headline: American Gas Association names new president.

text.p: The American Gas Association Wednesday named David Parker as president, replacing Michael Baly, who quit last April.
Parker, who was approved unanimously by the AGA board, comes from the Aluminum Association, where he has been president since 1989, an AGA spokeswoman said.
He earlier worked for the Edison Electric Institute, which represents investor-owned utilities.
AGA, with a $29 million annual budget, represents about 250 natural gas distribution companies which account for more than 90 percent of local natural gas deliveries.
